name: General Tullius
role: Military Governor of Skyrim and Commander of Imperial Legion forces

aspects.high_concept: The Empire's Iron Hand in Skyrim
aspects.trouble: He Doesn't Understand Skyrim - and Doesn't Realize He Needs To
other_aspects: The War Ends When I Say It Ends
The Thalmor Are an Inconvenience, Not an Enemy
Rikke Understands These Nords Better Than I Do

stunts: General's Authority: +2 to Command when issuing orders to Imperial soldiers; orders cannot be questioned without serious consequences.
Strategic Mind: Once per session, declare a free invoke on any battlefield aspect by announcing his tactical assessment.
Unshakeable Resolve: +2 to Will against Intimidation or fear; ignores first mild mental consequence per session.

equipment.special: Imperial writ of authority, strategic battle maps of Skyrim, Thalmor liaison documents

personality_notes.speaking_style: Clipped, military, and to the point. No sentiment. Occasionally reveals dry wit. Dismissive of Nord customs he doesn't understand.
motivations: End the rebellion and restore Imperial order in Skyrim
Advance his career through decisive victory
Protect the Empire's strategic position against future Thalmor aggression
Prove that disciplined Imperial forces can crush Nord 'barbarian' tactics
fears: Losing Skyrim to the Stormcloaks on his watch
Rikke being right that he doesn't understand what he's dealing with
The war dragging on and becoming unwinnable
quirks: Studies maps compulsively before any meeting
Cannot hide his frustration with Thalmor diplomatic requirements
Respects competence, regardless of origin - will acknowledge a good soldier
Uses 'Rikke, explain this' when Nord customs baffle him

relationships.Legate Rikke: Trusted tactical officer; values her more than he admits
relationships.Thalmor: Necessary political inconvenience; privately despises their interference
relationships.Ulfric Stormcloak: Rebel who must be put down; nothing personal
relationships.Jarl Balgruuf: Useful loyal jarl; a tool of Imperial strategy
relationships.The Player: Measures by results; will promote or dismiss based purely on effectiveness

trust_clock.description: Tullius grants trust through demonstrated military effectiveness. No sentiment - only results.
advancement_triggers: Win a significant engagement for the Legion (+2)
Provide actionable intelligence on Stormcloak positions (+1)
Survive a major battle and report in (+1)
setback_triggers: Interact with Thalmor in ways that complicate his diplomatic position (-1)

combat_tactics: Tullius rarely fights personally; he commands. In extremis, he is a highly trained swordsman who uses disciplined technique. Would rather win with positioning and numbers than personal valor.
scene_triggers: Battle of Whiterun War Room Briefing (referenced/off-screen for field commanders)
dialogue_examples: The rebellion ends when Ulfric Stormcloak's head is on a spike. Everything else is logistics.
I don't care about Nord customs. I care about holding Skyrim for the Empire.
Rikke, are they always this dramatic?
You've been effective. That's all that matters here. Don't ruin it by developing opinions.
gm_notes: Tullius represents the Empire's institutional blindness to Skyrim's culture. He is not evil - he is an administrator who sees the rebellion as an operational problem rather than a cultural crisis. His frustration with the Thalmor is genuine and can be leveraged. His reliance on Rikke should be visible. If used well, he provides dry comic relief while illustrating why the civil war started in the first place.
